meanings.definition: A food made from the pressed curds of milk.
meanings.sent1: I love to eat cheese with crackers.
meanings.sent2: The pizza was covered in melted cheese.
meanings.sent3: The mouse nibbled on the cheese, thinking it was a feast.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright and inviting as a block of cheese.
meanings.sent5: The cheese oozed out of the sandwich, tempting everyone nearby.

meanings.sent1: She couldn't help but cheese when she saw the surprise.
meanings.sent2: The children cheesed happily for the family photo.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes made everyone cheese from ear to ear.
meanings.sent4: His face cheesed with joy as he received the award.
meanings.sent5: The puppy's playful antics always make me cheese.

meanings.definition: To stop trying to continue in a game because one is certain of winning.
meanings.sent1: The team decided to cheese early since they were so far ahead.
meanings.sent2: He chose to cheese and let his opponent claim victory.
meanings.sent3: The chess player decided to cheese and give his opponent a chance.
meanings.sent4: Knowing he had won, he cheesed and relaxed in his chair.
meanings.sent5: She confidently cheesed, knowing the game was already won.
